==German== ===Etymology=== From {{etyl|gmh|de}} {{m|gmh|vil līchte||very easily}}, thus: “what could easily happen”. Compare the same in {{cog|nds-de|villicht}}, {{cog|nl|wellicht}}, {{cog|stq|fielicht}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/fiˈlaɪ̯çt/|/fɪˈlaɪ̯çt/}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/flaɪ̯ç(t)/}} {{a|often in common speech}} * {{audio|de|De-at-vielleicht.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{audio|de|De-vielleicht.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|de|aɪ̯çt}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # [[perhaps]], [[maybe]] #: '''''Vielleicht''' hat er einen Unfall gehabt.'' #:: '''Maybe''' he’s had an accident. # {{non-gloss definition|frequently replaces {{m|de|bitte||please}} in polite questions}} #: ''Könnten Sie '''vielleicht''' das Fenster aufmachen?'' #:: Could you '''perhaps''' open the window? # {{lb|de|colloquial}} {{non-gloss definition|expresses amazement or excitement, particularly at something negative}} #: ''Das is’ '''vielleicht''' ’ne Geldverschwendung da!'' #:: Now, that’s '''some''' waste of money! ====Usage notes==== * The use of ''vielleicht'' in a polite question is often preferable because it invites the person asked to disagree, whereas ''bitte'' may sound insisting. This depends a lot on context and intonation, however. ====Synonyms==== * {{l|de|möglicherweise}} * {{l|de|unter Umständen}} * {{l|de|womöglich}} [[Category:German modal particles]]
